page.title: 15Leisure in the Coxheath area
page.content: Although a large "urban" area, Coxheath has little to offer in the way of leisure. Two public houses in the centre, "The Bell" and the "Bird in Hand" provide the only facilities for "going out". Most of the other forms of leisure activities take place in or around the Village Hall (see page 9). Brownies, Guides, Scouts and Cubs meet regularly in the hut in Westerhill Road. For the young, there is a play area at the back of the Village Hall and the woods nearby provide extra play space. Coxheath and Farleigh boys football club meet regularly during the season and a gym club operates at the Junior School. The local branch of the Young Ornithologists Club meets at Heath House on Heath Road on Tuesdays.
